info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 16 at 1:26AM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Maricopa County through 215 AM MST... At 125 AM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Paradise Valley, moving northwest at 20 mph. HAZARD...Penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Phoenix, Glendale, Scottsdale, Peoria, Paradise Valley, New River, Cave Creek, Carefree, Piestewa Peak Park, Deer Valley Airport, North Mountain Park, Scottsdale Airport, Camelback Mountain and Desert Ridge Marketplace. This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 17 between mile markers 210 and 224. AZ Route 51 between mile markers 7 and 15. AZ Route 101 between mile markers 17 and 42. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
